body_content.explanation: a main meal eaten in the evening :
examples: Why don't you come to/for supper tonight?
They had an early supper before going to the theatre.

body_content.explanation: a small meal eaten in the late evening:
examples: We usually have tea at about 5.30 p.m. , then supper before we go to bed.

body_content.explanation: an event in which people come together to eat in the evening:
examples: They hosted a buffet supper on the lawn of their home.
Rita asked Rose to go to a church supper with her.

body_content.explanation: used with the name of a food to refer to a meal that is eaten with chips (= long, thin pieces of fried potato):
examples: The picture shows one of the famous Scottish deep-fried pizza suppers.
Glaswegians are definitely the masters of the sausage supper.
